The parrot may have had a speech impediment or difficulty with mimicry that prevented it from repeating words correctly.
The parrot may have been too intelligent to mimic certain words or phrases, leading to a lack of interest in repeating them.
The parrot may have been exposed to a different language or dialect that it was not programmed to mimic, leading to difficulty in repeating words in the desired language.
The parrot may have been distracted by its surroundings or other stimuli, preventing it from focusing on the task of repeating words.
The parrot may have beenaging or sick, leading to a decline in cognitive abilities and difficulty in mimicking words.
